required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate the Treatment With Sintilimab Injection Plus Endostar in Hepatocellular Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Arm, Observational Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Combination Treatment With Sintilimab Injection Plus Endostar in Untreated Locally Advanced or Metastatic Hepatocellular Carcinoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: It is a a single arm, observational clinical trial to evaluate the efficacy and safety of combination treatment with sintilimab injection plus endostar in untreated locally advanced or metastatic hepatocellular carcinoma.

detailed_description.textblock: For the first line treatment with untreated locally advanced or metastatic hepatocellular carcinoma, sintilimab injection plus endostar might be one of the treatment choices.

primary_outcome.description: The rate of participants that achieve either a complete response (CR) or a partial response (PR).
From date of enrollment until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first

secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as time from the start of treatment until death due to any reason.
The time between the first recorded and objective remission to the first onset of disease progression or all-cause death (whichever happens first)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as measured by number and grade of adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Summary adverse events according to NCI-CTCAE 4.03

study_pop.textblock: Untreated Locally Advanced or Metastatic Hepatocellular Carcinoma

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Huazhong University of Science and Technology
responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, Head of the cancer center
